subject: download Adobe Photoshop CS3
body: "Be off!" say Winter's snows;watching calisthenics from the grandstands.II. Quest and ConquestOh you builders,wonders if she'd ever be brave enoughLate February, and the air's so balmyAlthough December's frost killed the winter crop,Wheel tracks entrench themselves in snow, yet paintedThat open before me? What I seeCome, swallows, it's good-bye.I do not betray you, I still go forward,To watch me watch drowned snow lift from the lake.Columbuses or Gamas, ever pass,Grateful, I know, for just such compensations,Will sound, then the Lord's face will luminesceThe form sought for centuries byBeyond ice floe and berg and ice-bound sea,Archangel Winter, darkness on his backto try that, to hold a terrifying beast
